newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Karachi 100-share index falls below 1,600 points.
newsitem.headline: Karachi 100-share index falls below 1,600 points.

text.p: The Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share price index fell below the 1,600-point barrier to 1,598.03 on Monday on profit-taking, after rising more than 12 points to 1,605.96 in early trade, dealers said.
The index rose in the morning on fresh buying by speculators "celebrating freedom from the International Monetary Fund", dealer Azhar Batla of Taurus Securities said.
The IMF suspended an $830 million standby loan to Pakistan on Friday because agreed targets could not be met.
